summary: A utility for modders that prints information about targeted NPCs and items to the console.
descriptionHtml:
[size=4][color=#4cf]This mod displays information about targeted items and NPCs in the console.[/color][/size]
[color=#aaa][size=1][i]I originally wrote this for myself to get a better understanding of some of the "under the hood" workings of Skyrim but others may find it useful as well.[/i][/size][/color]


[size=4][color=#f92]How to use[/color][/size][size=3]
1. Equip the [color=#ccc][i]Inspect Item[/i][/color] power.
2. Target any item or NPC with your crosshair [b]or[/b] select an object in the console.
3. Activate the power and open the console to view the target data.
You can scroll through the text with the [code]Page Up[/code] and [code]Page Down[/code] keys.[/size]


[size=4][color=#f92]What is displayed[/color][/size][size=3]
The mod will show a good amount of the information available from papyrus (natively or through SKSE).
Supported item types are: [code]Form ObjectReference Actor Armor Weapon Ingredient[/code]
Since all targetable objects are subclasses of [code]Form[/code] and [code]ObjectReference[/code] the information for those will always be displayed.
Information for [code]Actor[/code]s includes that for their respective [code]ActorBase[/code].

The values are named according to their associated papyrus functions [i](Example: [code]Item Health Percent[/code] in the [code][ ObjectReference ][/code] section is the output of [code](target as ObjectReference).GetItemHealthPercent()[/code])[/i]. Documentation can be found on the CreationKit Wiki page for the relevant [url=http://www.creationkit.com/index.php?title=Category:Script_Objects]Papyrus Script Object[/url].
For some values the mod give more explanation, separated by a dash.
Example: [code]Item Health Percent: 1.7[color=#f88] - (2. Legendary)[/color][/code][/size]


[size=4][color=#f92]How to obtain[/color][/size][size=3]
The [color=#ccc][i]Inspect Item[/i][/color] power should be added to your spells as soon as you load the mod.
If it does not appear after a few seconds you can search for the FormID by typing [code]help "Inspect Item"[/code] into the console. Then add the power to the player with [code]player.addspell xx0012c5[/code] where [code]xx0012c5[/code] is the FormID as seen in the output from the previous command.[/size]


[size=4][color=#f92]Compatibility[/color][/size][size=3]
The mod does not modify any vanilla records and should be compatible with most other mods.
There is one script included which will only run when you activate the power.[/size]


[size=4][color=#f92]Requirements[/color][/size]
[list]
[*][size=3][url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]Skyrim Script Extender (SKSE)[/url] Version 1.7.3+ [/size][size=2][color=#aaa][i]needed to get much of the information from within papyrus[/i][/color][/size]
[*][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58705/?]PapyrusUtil[/url] [/size][size=2][i][color=#aaa]needed to print to the console[/color][/i][/size]
[/list]

[size=4][color=#f92]Recommendations[/color][/size]
[size=3] I highly recommend the mod [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/44596/?]Mfg Console[/url], which displays a lot of useful information in a nicely accessible format. This includes actor values which are left out by my mod.

I also recommend using a [code]fixed width font[/code] for the console. The one seen in the screenshots is [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/38808/?]DejaVu Sans Mono[/url]. Please note that you might have to modify your [code]Data/Interface/fontconfig.txt[/code] if you want to use more than one font replacer at the same time.

Skyrim INI Settings:
To display more information at once it can be useful to adjust the console. You can find detailed information in the [url=http://wiki.step-project.com/Guide:Skyrim_INI/Menu]S.T.E.P. Guide: Skyrim INI/Menu[/url]. Suggested settings (Skyrim.ini):
[/size][size=2][code][Menu]
iConsoleHistoryCharBufferSize=65536 [color=green][i]; allows you to scroll further back in the console[/i][/color]
iConsoleSizeScreenPercent=50 [color=green][i]; increases console height; if you don't use MfgConsole you might want to increase this further[/i][/color]
iConsoleTextSize=16 [color=green][i]; smaller size for more visible text and less scrolling[/i][/color][/code][/size]


[size=4][color=#f92]Credits & Thanks[/color][/size][size=3]
[i]Bethesda[/i] for Skyrim.
[i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/85199/?]Exiledviper[/url][/i] for PapyrusUtils' ability to print to the console.
[i]The SKSE team[/i] for providing a lot of functions not available in vanilla Skyrim.
Everybody who has contributed to the CreationKit Wiki.
[/size]
author: underthesky
